title: HELP! Patch 4.21 not patching. The logo appears and then nothing happens
body: Trying to load the new patch today but the logo appears and the little bars loads but then everything disappears and nothing happens. Opening the task manager shows the LoL patcher, Riot client patcher, and the PvP.net Patcher Kernal all there but not running. Been closing it and reopening and letting is sit for a while and it just closes itself. Opening as admin made no difference. HELP

replies.body:
Hey everyone!

Check out [this Discussion](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/ERAqgjGs-bug-my-patcher-will-not-open-after-patch-421) for help on how to resolve this issue! There are a few steps there that you guys can take to get the game working again!

> [{quoted}](name=Digital Ram,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=8nkT4j90,comment-id=000e,timestamp=2014-12-11T21:13:56.188+0000)
> Hey everyone!
> 
> Check out [this Discussion](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/ERAqgjGs-bug-my-patcher-will-not-open-after-patch-421) for help on how to resolve this issue! There are a few steps there that you guys can take to get the game working again!

This doesn't address how to fix the problem on Macs, just like every other solution thrown out there.

Are you receiving the same symptoms as the OP, where you click the launcher and the game does not load? If so, could you attach the Patcher logs and Patcher UX logs? You can find them on your Mac:

Applications/League of Legends/Contents/LOL/Logs/Patcher Logs

Please attach your most up to date logs!

> [{quoted}](name=Digital Ram,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=8nkT4j90,comment-id=000e00000000,timestamp=2014-12-12T01:56:46.740+0000)

> 
> Applications/League of Legends/Contents/LOL/Logs/Patcher Logs
> 
> Please attach your most up to date logs!

so... this happened to me, and i got reported because of this "unable to connect" issue. I was able to eventually fix it thanks to your help but now the Leaver Buster system keeps asking me to "agree." but i will not agree because i did not willingly leave. so either fix this... or goodbye

I'm having the same exact problem and it's infuriating because I don't even get an idea of what's wrong with the process. I tried turning off my firewall, changing the DNS to public, deleting the launcher and patcher files, uninstalling & reinstalling, etc. Nothing has worked so far.
At least its not just me then. I'm just going to keep refreshing the help boards and keep trying to start League for a while. Will let know if any change occurs.

1) Go to C:\Windows\system32\drivers\etc
2) Open "host" file

Make sure your localhost is 127.0.0.1

you may want to copy the host file to another location change it then save it and copy it back 

cus windows won't let you save directly on the origin location

I only have "hosts" not "host" and it won't let me change anything, when it opens all I get it is :

I have an macbook and is "clean my mac" considered as a virus program?

> [{quoted}](name=helpfulolguys,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=8nkT4j90,comment-id=0014,timestamp=2015-01-11T10:53:37.982+0000)

http://www.pcadvisor.co.uk/reviews/software/3444051/cleanmymac-2-review/

The program seems legitimate and has reviews from multiple critics. 
And it even has it's own Wikipedia page!

I think i am having a similar problem but mine seems to load when i opened up the league program and a white bar starts to load on my docks for macs. and it doesn't seem to quit but when it opens it says "LoLPatcher Ux". I even tried reinstalling and changing the User Kernal but still won't work! Help me please!

I have windows 8 and none of these solutions helped me, But I fixed it.

*Disclaimer: you have to remove a security/ antivirus app or program software etc. But you can still have the function of it, but no more manual security scans*

1. Right click on the icon or folder/ document of the security software, and press delete. There will still be remainders of the software around your computer.

2. Go to your control Panel, (windows 8 users Go to PC settings and you should find the control panel link on the bottom left of the page)

3. On the bottom left of the control panel, it should say Programs, with Uninstall a program option underneath it.

4. Find the program (for me it was AVG) and double-click on it, there should be an uninstall button once you double tap it.

5. It will take several minutes to uninstall, and once finished it will give you the option to still have an AVG antivirus program and choosing that will not affect the outcome

6. Restart your computer, open league, and wait for the patch to finish. Then launch. GL

BTW I was using a mac and with this new update the logo appeared and then if you look at your dock it shows a progress bar. That progress bar took about 10 minutes to finish before it finally opened the launcher and did the real patch. So try that if you are using a mac.

> [{quoted}](name=Carl Fredrickson,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=8nkT4j90,comment-id=0010,timestamp=2014-12-12T02:15:23.875+0000)
> BTW I was using a mac and with this new update the logo appeared and then if you look at your dock it shows a progress bar. That progress bar took about 10 minutes to finish before it finally opened the launcher and did the real patch. So try that if you are using a mac.

The progress bar fully loaded and then it closes. Whenever you open it afterwards it creates a Launcher dock icon and then closes immediately.

I had this too and I managed to launch the launcher by starting:
Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_launcher\releases\{Latest Version}\deploy\LoLLauncher.exe

Hope that works for you.

Anyone have any luck with anything so far?

Maybe it's a conflict with windows?
maybe it's an errant code causing it to not work properly with a certain program?

I just want this to be resolved as soon as possible.

I've submitted a support ticket, with my patcher logs attached, hopefully I'll get a response soon, but 2 hours in hasn't yielded anything.
You should try and submit one too.

The patch logs can be obtained through C:\Riotgames\LeagueofLegends\Logs\Patcher Logs\
and just attach the most recent ones to it.

I don't know if it will help. but those files should help decrease the process time, without them having to ask for them if they do end up needing them.

Chin up, it'll work out somehow, in the mean time, there's always Tetris!

You need to restart and then disable both fws before you launch to patch also get rid of your router if you have one and the problem persists.

I attempted this, removed the router I had the connection coming from and directly connected it to the computer, but the problem doesn't seem to be, and I never suspected it to be, the internet it self.

I think I've restarted my computer today more times than when I newly installed windows on it lol

Hopefully we'll come to a solution soon.

I'm having the same issue. Patch won't patch! Come on, riot. This has started happening with your new patcher. I thought this was going to be the better patcher?
Confirmed, restarting and then disabling FW's worked for me.

On both computers that I updated, Windows Firewall popped up double Firewall exclusion messages and it messed up the patcher until I unblocked lolpatcher.exe with the messages.  I've been running LoL for months with no problem on Windows 7 (I think I unblocked it the first install) so they might have changed the exe ID or something.  I run Avast Anti-virus and it didn't freak out on me, but another AV program might be doing something because of change Riot made.

Dunno if that helps you guys but it definitely did something different today than with other patches.

> Dunno if that helps you guys but it definitely did something different today than with other patches.

Same exact thing happened to me and also use Avast, thing is I already disabled both windows and Avast FW and still no go, perhaps I need to restart and then disable it to patch.
Same thing happened here, it said my firewall has blocked the patch but i allowed access then it disappeared and then what i described above happened.

Check your firewall directly.  "Control Panel > Windows Firewall > Allowed Programs" and enable the two LoL programs.  Re-installing LoL won't help if the exe ID is still being blocked in your firewall.  If you have another firewall software then you have to find the list.  It popped up two messages and if you only got one that means one of the LoL programs never got unlocked maybe.

- League of Legends Launcher
- LoL Patcher

are the two I have.
